strengths.evidence: Strong running background with 25-min 5K, good running economy and pacing awareness

limiters.evidence: Beginner swimmer - can swim 200m continuously but stroke needs significant work, limited pool experience

constraints: Pool access weekday mornings and weekends
Primary goal is to finish comfortably and have fun

phases.name: Base
phases.focus: Build technique foundation in swim, establish training consistency across all three sports

phases.name: Recovery
phases.focus: Active recovery week to absorb training adaptations

phases.name: Build
phases.focus: Race-specific preparation with brick workouts and increased intensity
keyWorkouts: Continuous swim building to race distance

phases.name: Taper
phases.focus: Rest, sharpen, and prepare for race day

weeks.focus: Establish training rhythm, heavy focus on swim technique

workouts.name: Swim Technique Intro
workouts.description: Foundation session focusing on body position and catch mechanics. Take your time with drills - quality over quantity.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 100m easy freestyle, rest as needed

Drill Block (200m total):
4x25m kick on side (switch sides each 25)
4x25m catch-up drill (touch fingertips before next stroke)

Main Set:
4x50m freestyle @ 2:30/100m pace
Rest 20 seconds between each
Focus: Long strokes, exhale underwater

Cool-down: 100m easy backstroke or choice

TIP: Count your strokes per length - aim for consistency

workouts.name: Easy Aerobic Run
workouts.description: Comfortable aerobic run to maintain your running fitness while building triathlon training load.
workouts.humanReadable:
35 minutes easy running

Pace: 9:30-10:00/mile (comfortable conversation pace)
HR Target: 139-153 (Zone 2)

Focus on:
- Relaxed shoulders
- Quick cadence (170-180 steps/min)
- Breathing rhythm

This should feel EASY. If you're breathing hard, slow down.

workouts.name: Aerobic Base Ride
workouts.description: Steady endurance ride building cycling fitness. Focus on smooth pedaling and consistent effort.
workouts.humanReadable:
45 minutes steady cycling

Power Target: 83-113W (Zone 2)
Cadence: 85-95 rpm

Structure:
- 5 min easy spin warm-up
- 35 min steady Zone 2
- 5 min easy cool-down

Tips:
- Stay seated on climbs when possible
- Practice drinking from bottle while riding
- Keep upper body relaxed

workouts.name: Swim Drills + Endurance
workouts.description: Continue building technique with drills, adding slightly more continuous swimming.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 150m easy (50 free, 50 back, 50 free)

Drill Block (250m):
4x25m fingertip drag drill
2x50m catch-up drill
50m fist drill (swim with closed fists)

Main Set:
4x100m @ 2:30/100m pace
Rest 30 seconds between each
Focus: Bilateral breathing (every 3 strokes)

Cool-down: 100m easy choice

NOTE: 30% of this session is drills - that's intentional for technique building

workouts.name: Triathlon Strength Foundation
workouts.description: Full-body strength session to build durability and prevent injury. Focus on movement quality.
workouts.humanReadable:
Dynamic Warm-up (5 min):
- Leg swings (10 each direction)
- Arm circles (20 total)
- Walking lunges (10 each leg)
- High knees (30 seconds)

Circuit - 2 Rounds:
- Squats: 12 reps
- Push-ups: 10 reps (modify on knees if needed)
- Single-leg deadlifts: 8 each leg
- Plank: 30 seconds
- Superman holds: 10 reps (3 sec hold each)
- Bird dogs: 8 each side
- Glute bridges: 15 reps

Rest 60 seconds between rounds

Cool-down: Light stretching focusing on hip flexors and shoulders

workouts.name: Long Aerobic Ride
workouts.description: Your longest ride of the week. Build cycling endurance and practice race nutrition.
workouts.humanReadable:
70 minutes steady cycling

Power Target: 83-113W (Zone 2)
Cadence: 85-95 rpm

Structure:
- 10 min easy warm-up
- 50 min steady Zone 2
- 10 min easy cool-down

Nutrition Practice:
- Drink 500-750ml during ride
- Try eating a small snack (banana, bar) at 45 min

This is about time in the saddle - don't push the pace!

workouts.name: Long Easy Run
workouts.description: Build running endurance with an easy, conversational-pace long run.
workouts.humanReadable:
45 minutes easy running

Pace: 9:30-10:30/mile
HR Target: Under 153 (Zone 2)

This should feel comfortable enough to chat.
Walk breaks are OK if HR climbs too high.

Mental cue: 'Easy means easy'

Post-run: Light stretching, foam roll if available

weeks.focus: Progress swim technique, add first brick workout

workouts.name: Swim Technique + Build
workouts.description: Continue technique development with slightly longer main set. Focus on rotation and catch.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy (mix of free and back)

Drill Block (250m):
4x25m kick on side with rotation
4x25m single-arm freestyle (switch arms each 25)
50m 6-3-6 drill (6 kicks on side, 3 strokes, 6 kicks)

Main Set:
5x100m @ 2:30/100m pace
Rest 25 seconds between each
Odd 100s: Focus on high elbow catch
Even 100s: Focus on hip rotation

Cool-down: 150m easy pull with buoy

Progress check: How many strokes per 25m?

workouts.name: Easy Run + Strides
workouts.description: Aerobic run with strides to maintain leg speed and running economy.
workouts.humanReadable:
Easy running with strides

Main Run: 25 minutes easy (Zone 2)
Pace: 9:30-10:00/mile

Strides (after main run):
4 x 20 seconds at faster pace (not sprinting)
Walk/jog 40 seconds recovery between

Easy jog: 5 minutes cool-down

Strides should feel smooth and quick, not straining
Focus on quick turnover and relaxed form

workouts.name: Aerobic Ride + Cadence
workouts.description: Build cycling fitness with cadence drills to improve pedaling efficiency.
workouts.humanReadable:
50 minutes with cadence work

Warm-up: 10 min easy spin

Main Set:
5 x 3 min high cadence (100+ rpm) @ Zone 2 power
with 2 min normal cadence (85-90 rpm) between

Cool-down: 10 min easy spin

Power Target: Stay in Zone 2 throughout
Focus: Smooth circles, no bouncing in saddle

High cadence teaches your legs to turn over efficiently

workouts.name: Swim Endurance Builder
workouts.description: Building continuous swimming ability with technique focus maintained.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy free

Drill Block (200m):
4x25m catch-up drill
4x25m fingertip drag

Main Set:
3x200m @ 2:30/100m pace
Rest 40 seconds between each
Focus: Steady pace, consistent stroke count

Speed Touch:
4x25m @ faster effort (2:10/100m pace)
Rest 20 seconds between

Cool-down: 100m easy backstroke

You're building toward 750m race distance!

workouts.name: Triathlon Strength
workouts.description: Strength session building on week 1. Slightly more volume.
workouts.humanReadable:
Dynamic Warm-up (5 min):
- Leg swings, arm circles
- Inchworms x 5
- World's greatest stretch x 4 each side

Circuit - 3 Rounds:
- Goblet squats or bodyweight squats: 12 reps
- Push-ups: 12 reps
- Romanian deadlifts (single leg): 8 each
- Plank: 40 seconds
- Side plank: 20 seconds each side
- Clamshells: 15 each side
- Superman with arm extension: 10 reps

Rest 45 seconds between exercises, 90 seconds between rounds

Cool-down: Hip flexor and shoulder stretches

workouts.name: First Brick: Bike to Run
workouts.description: Your first brick workout! Experience the bike-to-run transition sensation. The goal is to learn what 'brick legs' feel like.
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE: 45 minutes Zone 2
Power: 83-113W
Cadence: 85-90 rpm
Last 5 min: Increase cadence to 95-100 rpm to prep legs

TRANSITION:
- Quick change of shoes
- Don't overthink it - just go!

RUN: 15 minutes easy
Pace: Whatever feels manageable (expect it to feel weird!)

NOTES:
- Your legs WILL feel strange - this is normal
- First few minutes are the hardest
- Don't stop even if it feels awkward
- Focus on quick, short strides initially

This is about adaptation, not speed!

workouts.name: Long Easy Run
workouts.description: Build running endurance. Keep it comfortable after yesterday's brick.
workouts.humanReadable:
50 minutes easy running

Pace: 9:30-10:30/mile
HR Target: Under 153 (Zone 2)

Your legs may feel heavy from yesterday's brick.
That's expected - run by feel, not pace.

Mid-run check:
- Am I breathing comfortably?
- Can I talk in full sentences?
- If not, slow down!

Walk breaks are perfectly acceptable

weeks.focus: Peak base week - highest volume before recovery week

workouts.name: Swim Technique + Threshold Touch
workouts.description: Continue technique work with introduction of threshold-pace swimming.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy (free/back mix)

Drill Block (200m):
4x25m catch-up drill
4x25m single-arm free

Main Set 1 - Endurance:
4x150m @ 2:30/100m pace
Rest 30 seconds between
Focus: Consistent stroke count and rhythm

Main Set 2 - Threshold Touch:
4x50m @ CSS pace (2:15/100m)
Rest 20 seconds between
This should feel 'comfortably hard'

Cool-down: 150m easy with pull buoy

You're swimming over race distance now!

workouts.name: Tempo Introduction
workouts.description: First tempo work to develop race pace awareness. Short tempo intervals with full recovery.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 10 min easy jog

Main Set:
3 x 5 minutes @ Tempo (Zone 3)
Pace: 7:45-8:15/mile
HR: 153-162
Recovery: 2 min easy jog between

Cool-down: 10 min easy jog

Tempo should feel 'comfortably hard'
- You can talk in short sentences
- Not gasping but definitely working
- This is your approximate race pace for 5K run leg

Don't start too fast on first interval!

workouts.name: Steady State Ride
workouts.description: Solid aerobic ride building toward race distance cycling.
workouts.humanReadable:
55 minutes steady riding

Power Target: 90-110W (Zone 2)
Cadence: 85-95 rpm

Structure:
- 10 min easy warm-up
- 40 min steady Zone 2
- 5 min easy cool-down

During ride, practice:
- Staying low on handlebars for periods
- Drinking without losing rhythm
- Gear selection on any hills

You're getting close to race distance (20km)!

workouts.name: Race Distance Simulation
workouts.description: Build toward continuous 750m swimming. This is a confidence builder.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy (include 50m backstroke)

Drill Block (150m):
6x25m alternating: catch-up, fingertip drag

Main Set - Building Continuous Swim:
500m continuous @ 2:30/100m pace
(That's 20 lengths of 25m pool or 10 lengths of 50m pool)
Rest 60 seconds

Descending Set:
4x75m descending 1-4 (each one faster than previous)
Start @ 2:30/100m, finish @ 2:15/100m
Rest 20 seconds between

Cool-down: 150m easy choice

You just swam 500m straight! Race distance is 750m - you've got this!

workouts.name: Triathlon Strength
workouts.description: Maintain strength foundation. Keep it moderate before big weekend.
workouts.humanReadable:
Dynamic Warm-up (5 min):
- Mobility flow
- Leg swings
- Arm circles

Circuit - 2 Rounds:
- Squats: 15 reps
- Push-ups: 12 reps
- Step-ups: 10 each leg
- Plank: 45 seconds
- Russian twists: 20 total
- Single-leg glute bridges: 10 each
- Dead bugs: 8 each side

Rest 45 seconds between exercises

Keeping it moderate today - big brick tomorrow!

workouts.name: Long Brick Workout
workouts.description: Your biggest brick of the base phase. Simulate race-like effort and practice transitions.
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE: 55 minutes
Power: 90-110W (Zone 2)
Cadence: 88-95 rpm

Bike Structure:
- 10 min easy warm-up
- 35 min steady Zone 2
- 10 min slightly harder (high Zone 2)
- Last 5 min: High cadence (95-100 rpm)

TRANSITION PRACTICE:
- Set up transition area before workout
- Practice: shoes off, running shoes on, GO!
- Time yourself

RUN: 20 minutes
- First 5 min: Easy, find your legs
- Middle 10 min: Steady Zone 2
- Final 5 min: Pick up slightly if feeling good

Pace expectation: Your legs will feel heavy.
First mile will feel weird. Push through - it gets better!

Nutrition: Drink and eat small amount during bike

workouts.name: Long Easy Run
workouts.description: Final long run before recovery week. Easy effort after yesterday's brick.
workouts.humanReadable:
55 minutes easy running

Pace: 9:30-10:30/mile (or slower if tired)
HR Target: Under 153 (Zone 2)

Post-brick recovery run:
- Expect heavy legs for first 10-15 min
- Don't chase pace - run by feel
- Walk breaks encouraged if needed

You've completed 3 weeks of base training!
Recovery week is next - you've earned it.

weeks.focus: Active recovery - absorb training, stay fresh mentally

workouts.name: Complete Rest
workouts.description: Full rest day. Light stretching or yoga OK if desired.

workouts.name: Easy Technique Swim
workouts.description: Low-volume technique session. Focus on quality movement, not fitness.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy choice

Drill Block (300m):
4x25m catch-up drill - perfect your catch
4x25m fingertip drag - high elbow recovery
4x25m 6-3-6 drill - rotation and balance

Main Set:
4x100m @ easy pace (2:40/100m)
Rest 30 seconds between
Focus: Technique only, no effort

No cool-down needed

Recovery week = technical refinement, not fitness building

workouts.name: Recovery Spin
workouts.description: Very easy spinning to keep legs moving without adding fatigue.
workouts.humanReadable:
35 minutes very easy spinning

Power: Under 83W (Zone 1)
Cadence: 90-95 rpm
HR: Under 130

This should feel like doing nothing.
If you're working at all, you're going too hard.

Purpose: Blood flow, active recovery

Enjoy the easy ride!

workouts.name: Recovery Jog
workouts.description: Easy recovery run to maintain feel without adding stress.
workouts.humanReadable:
25 minutes very easy jogging

Pace: 10:00-11:00/mile (slower than normal easy)
HR: Under 139 (Zone 1)

This is a 'shake out' run:
- Keep it conversational
- Walk if you need to
- No watches, no pressure

Your body is adapting from the last 3 weeks.
Let it happen!

workouts.name: Rest Day
workouts.description: Complete rest or light stretching/yoga.

workouts.name: Moderate Endurance Ride
workouts.description: Slightly longer but still easy ride to maintain cycling feel.
workouts.humanReadable:
50 minutes easy cycling

Power: 83-100W (low Zone 2)
Cadence: 90+ rpm

Stay comfortable throughout.
No pushing, no tempo work.

Include some higher cadence spinning (100+ rpm)
for 2-3 min periods to keep legs fresh.

Enjoy being outside on the bike!

workouts.name: Easy Run + Strides
workouts.description: Easy run with strides to prep for build phase starting next week.
workouts.humanReadable:
35 minutes easy running

Main Run: 25 min easy (Zone 2)

Strides (after main run):
6 x 20 seconds building to fast
Full recovery walk/jog between

Cool-down: 5 min easy jog

Strides wake up the neuromuscular system
for the build phase starting tomorrow.

Recovery week complete!
You should feel fresh and ready to build.

workouts.name: Threshold Swim Session
workouts.description: Race-pace work to build swim-specific fitness and pacing awareness.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy (include 50m backstroke)

Drill Block (150m):
6x25m mixed drills - your choice

Main Set 1 - CSS Work:
6x100m @ 2:15/100m (CSS pace)
Rest 20 seconds between
This is threshold effort - 'comfortably hard'

Main Set 2 - Speed Touch:
4x50m @ 2:05/100m (faster than CSS)
Rest 25 seconds between

Cool-down: 150m easy pull

CSS work teaches your body race pace.
Stay controlled - don't go out too fast on first interval!

workouts.name: Run Intervals
workouts.description: Develop speed and running economy with interval training.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 10 min easy jog + 4x30s strides

Main Set:
5 x 3 minutes @ Threshold (Zone 4)
Pace: 7:15-7:45/mile
HR: 162-172
Recovery: 2 min easy jog between

Cool-down: 10 min easy jog

These are harder than tempo!
You should be breathing hard but controlled.
Not all-out - save that for race day.

Focus on smooth, quick cadence throughout intervals.

workouts.name: Tempo Intervals on Bike
workouts.description: Race-effort work on the bike to build muscular endurance.
workouts.humanReadable:
55 minutes with tempo intervals

Warm-up: 12 min easy spin

Main Set:
3 x 8 min @ Tempo (Zone 3)
Power: 113-135W
Cadence: 88-92 rpm
Recovery: 4 min easy spin between

Cool-down: 10 min easy

Tempo should feel sustainable but requires focus.
You're building race-specific bike fitness.

This effort is similar to what you'll hold on race day.

workouts.name: Race Distance Swim
workouts.description: Continuous swim at race distance to build confidence and pacing.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy

Drill Block (100m):
4x25m mixed drills

MAIN SET - THE BIG ONE:
750m continuous @ 2:20-2:25/100m
This is your race distance!
Break it into mental chunks:
- First 250m: Settle in, find rhythm
- Middle 250m: Steady, consistent
- Final 250m: Hold form, finish strong

Rest 2 minutes

Descending Set:
4x75m descending 1-4
Rest 20 seconds between

Cool-down: 100m easy

CONGRATS! You just swam your race distance!

workouts.name: Triathlon Strength
workouts.description: Maintain strength with moderate session before brick weekend.
workouts.humanReadable:
Dynamic Warm-up (5 min):
- Movement prep
- Activation exercises

Circuit - 2 Rounds:
- Squats: 15 reps
- Push-ups: 12 reps
- Lunges: 10 each leg
- Plank: 45 seconds
- Mountain climbers: 20 total
- Glute bridges: 15 reps
- Dead bugs: 10 each side

Rest 30 seconds between exercises

Keep it moderate - brick tomorrow!

workouts.name: Race Simulation Brick
workouts.description: Race-like brick workout. Practice race effort and transitions.
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE: 50 minutes
- 10 min easy warm-up
- 30 min @ race effort (Zone 2-3, 100-125W)
- 10 min progressive build to finish (Zone 3)
- Last 3 min: High cadence prep for run

TRANSITION:
Practice like it's race day!
- Bike shoes off while coasting
- Quick dismount
- Running shoes on, hat, GO!

RUN: 20 minutes @ race pace
- First 5 min: Find your legs (allow awkwardness)
- Next 15 min: Race pace (8:00-8:30/mile)

This should feel like race effort!
Practice your nutrition during bike portion.

workouts.name: Long Easy Run
workouts.description: Easy long run to build endurance and recover from brick.
workouts.humanReadable:
50 minutes easy running

Pace: 9:30-10:30/mile
HR: Under 153 (Zone 2)

Post-brick recovery run:
- Start very easy
- Let legs find their rhythm
- No pace pressure

Reflect on yesterday's brick:
- How did transition feel?
- How long until legs felt normal on run?

You're building race-day confidence!

weeks.focus: Peak build week - highest quality work

workouts.name: Quality Threshold Swim
workouts.description: Race-pace work with increased volume. Key swim session of the week.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 250m easy (100 free, 100 back, 50 choice)

Drill Block (150m):
2x25m catch-up
2x25m fingertip drag
2x25m sculling

Main Set 1 - Race Pace:
3x250m @ 2:20/100m (slightly faster than race pace)
Rest 40 seconds between
Focus: Consistent splits, strong finish each

Main Set 2 - Speed:
6x50m @ 2:05/100m
Rest 20 seconds between
Focus: Quick turnover, powerful catch

Cool-down: 150m easy pull

You're swimming 750m sets now!
Race distance will feel very manageable.

workouts.name: Tempo Run
workouts.description: Sustained tempo effort to build lactate threshold.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 10 min easy jog + 4x20s strides

Main Set:
20 minutes continuous @ Tempo (Zone 3)
Pace: 7:45-8:15/mile
HR: 153-162

Cool-down: 10 min easy jog

This is the longest tempo you've done!
20 minutes at this effort builds serious fitness.

Mental game:
- Break it into 5-min chunks
- 'Just 5 more minutes' x 4
- Stay relaxed, especially shoulders

workouts.name: Race Effort Bike
workouts.description: Extended tempo work simulating race bike leg effort.
workouts.humanReadable:
60 minutes with race simulation

Warm-up: 10 min easy spin

Main Set:
2 x 15 min @ Race Effort (Zone 3)
Power: 115-130W
Cadence: 90 rpm
Recovery: 5 min easy between

Cool-down: 10 min easy spin

Race effort = sustainable but focused.
You should be able to talk in short sentences.

This simulates what the bike leg will feel like.
Practice your aero position during tempo intervals.

workouts.name: Swim Endurance + Technique
workouts.description: Maintain swim volume with technique focus.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy

Drill Block (200m):
8x25m alternating: catch-up, single-arm

Main Set:
5x200m @ 2:30/100m (comfortable pace)
Rest 30 seconds between
Focus: Bilateral breathing every 3 strokes

Cool-down: 200m easy choice

Today is about volume and technique.
No intensity - save energy for weekend brick.

workouts.name: Pre-Brick Strength
workouts.description: Light strength session to activate muscles before brick weekend.
workouts.humanReadable:
Dynamic Warm-up (5 min):
- Mobility work
- Activation drills

Circuit - 2 Rounds (lighter than usual):
- Squats: 12 reps
- Push-ups: 10 reps
- Single-leg RDL: 8 each leg
- Plank: 30 seconds
- Glute bridges: 12 reps
- Bird dogs: 8 each side

Rest 30 seconds between exercises

Keep this light - big brick tomorrow!

workouts.name: Peak Brick - Full Simulation
workouts.description: Your biggest brick of the plan. Full race distance bike + race-effort run.
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE: 55 minutes at RACE DISTANCE (20km)
- 10 min easy warm-up
- 35 min @ race effort (Zone 2-3, 105-125W)
- 10 min build to strong finish (Zone 3)
- Final 3 min: High cadence (95+ rpm)

TRANSITION:
Full race simulation!
- Practice exactly as you would race day
- Helmet off, shoes on, GO!
- Time it!

RUN: 25 minutes
- First 5 min: 8:30-9:00/mile (settling in)
- Middle 15 min: 8:00-8:30/mile (race pace)
- Final 5 min: 7:45-8:00/mile (if you have it)

NUTRITION PRACTICE:
- Eat/drink during bike as you will race day
- Water at transition

This is your dress rehearsal!
After today, you KNOW you can do this.

workouts.name: Recovery Run
workouts.description: Easy recovery run after peak brick. Keep it very easy.
workouts.humanReadable:
40 minutes very easy running

Pace: 10:00-11:00/mile
HR: Under 145 (Zone 1-2)

Pure recovery after yesterday's big effort.
No goals except easy movement.

Reflect on yesterday's brick:
- Transitions smooth?
- Energy level on run?
- Nutrition working?

You're ready for race week next week!

weeks.focus: Final build week, maintain fitness, start freshening

workouts.name: Technique + Race Pace
workouts.description: Refinement session with race-pace touches.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy

Drill Block (200m):
8x25m mixed drills - focus on your weakest area

Main Set:
4x150m @ 2:25/100m (race pace)
Rest 30 seconds between
Focus: Smooth, efficient, repeatable

Speed Touch:
4x50m @ 2:00/100m (faster than race pace)
Rest 25 seconds between
Focus: Quick arms, powerful catch

Cool-down: 150m easy pull

Race pace should feel comfortable now.
That's the goal - you've built fitness!

workouts.name: Tempo with Strides
workouts.description: Quality tempo work with fast finish strides.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 10 min easy jog

Main Set:
15 minutes @ Tempo (Zone 3)
Pace: 7:45-8:15/mile

Recovery: 3 min easy jog

Strides:
4 x 30 seconds @ 5K race pace
Full recovery (60-90 seconds) between

Cool-down: 7 min easy jog

Shorter tempo than last week - quality over quantity.
Strides keep your speed sharp for race day.

workouts.name: Aerobic Ride + Openers
workouts.description: Mostly easy with race-effort openers to stay sharp.
workouts.humanReadable:
50 minutes with openers

Warm-up: 15 min easy spin

Main Ride:
25 min Zone 2 steady

Openers (staying fresh, not building fatigue):
3 x 2 min @ race effort (Zone 3)
2 min easy between

Cool-down: 8 min easy spin

These openers keep your legs 'race ready'
without adding significant fatigue.

workouts.name: Moderate Endurance Swim
workouts.description: Maintain swim feel with moderate volume.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy

Drill Block (100m):
4x25m your favorite drills

Main Set:
3x250m @ comfortable pace (2:30-2:35/100m)
Rest 35 seconds between
No stress - just swimming

Cool-down: 150m easy choice

Stay in the water, maintain feel.
Volume is dropping as we approach race week.

workouts.name: Rest Day
workouts.description: Complete rest before final brick. Light stretching OK.

workouts.name: Final Brick - Sharpener
workouts.description: Short, quality brick to stay race-ready without adding fatigue.
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE: 35 minutes
- 10 min easy warm-up
- 15 min @ race effort (Zone 3)
- 10 min with 3x1min @ slightly harder, 2 min easy between

QUICK TRANSITION
Practice your race-day routine

RUN: 15 minutes
- 5 min easy find your legs
- 8 min @ race pace (8:00-8:30/mile)
- 2 min easy cool-down

This is your FINAL brick before race day!
Keep it controlled - you're just staying sharp.

You've done the work. Trust your fitness!

workouts.name: Easy Run
workouts.description: Short easy run to stay loose. Race week starts tomorrow!
workouts.humanReadable:
30 minutes very easy running

Pace: 9:30-10:30/mile
HR: Under 145 (Zone 1-2)

Just moving and staying loose.
No intensity whatsoever.

RACE WEEK STARTS TOMORROW!
Enjoy the taper - you've earned it.

weeks.focus: RACE WEEK - Rest, sharpen, trust your training

workouts.name: Race Week Swim - Stay Sharp
workouts.description: Light swim to maintain feel and confidence.
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 200m easy

Drill Block (100m):
4x25m catch-up drill - perfect your stroke

Main Set:
4x100m @ race pace (2:20/100m)
Rest 25 seconds between
Focus: Smooth, confident, relaxed

Cool-down: 100m easy

This is about FEEL, not fitness.
You're not building anything this week.
Just stay connected to the water.

workouts.name: Shakeout Run + Strides
workouts.description: Easy running with strides to keep legs fresh and quick.
workouts.humanReadable:
15 minutes very easy running
Pace: 9:30-10:30/mile

Strides:
4 x 20 seconds @ race pace
Full recovery between

5 minutes easy jog cool-down

Strides keep neuromuscular system awake.
These should feel EASY and FAST.

No huffing and puffing - save it for Sunday!

workouts.name: Easy Spin + Openers
workouts.description: Light spin with a few openers to stay race-ready.
workouts.humanReadable:
30 minutes easy spinning

Main:
20 min Zone 1 easy spin

Openers:
3 x 1 min @ race effort
2 min easy between

Cool-down: 5 min easy

Purpose: Keep legs turning, stay sharp.
This is NOT a workout - it's maintenance.

workouts.name: Rest Day
workouts.description: Complete rest. Focus on hydration and carb loading.
workouts.humanReadable:
COMPLETE REST

Today's focus:
- Stay hydrated (clear or light yellow urine)
- Start carb loading (more pasta, rice, bread)
- Lay out race gear
- Review race plan
- Get to bed early

NO training needed. Trust your fitness!
Your body is absorbing 8 weeks of work.

workouts.name: Final Swim - Race Eve
workouts.description: Short, easy swim to stay loose. Last time in water before race!
workouts.humanReadable:
Warm-up: 100m easy

Main:
4x50m @ race pace with 15 seconds rest
Just touching race effort, staying smooth

Drill:
100m catch-up drill - feel the catch

Easy finish: 100m easy choice

Purpose: Feel the water, stay confident.
After this, you're DONE training!

Visualize your race swim during this session.

workouts.name: Race Eve Shakeout
workouts.description: Final short run to shake out pre-race nerves and stay loose.
workouts.humanReadable:
10 minutes VERY easy jogging

4 x 15 seconds @ race pace
Walk recovery between

3 minutes walking cool-down

Pre-race checklist:
- Gear bag packed
- Nutrition ready
- Alarm set
- Race morning plan clear
- Transition area visualized

Early dinner, early bed!
You've got this!

workouts.name: SPRINT TRIATHLON - RACE DAY!
workouts.description: This is it! Time to put 8 weeks of training to the test. Enjoy every moment!
workouts.humanReadable:
RACE DAY!

=== PRE-RACE MORNING ===
- Wake 2.5-3 hours before start
- Breakfast: What you've practiced (oatmeal, banana, toast)
- Arrive 90 min early minimum
- Set up transition: Bike gear on left, run gear on right
- 10 min easy swim warm-up if possible

=== SWIM: 750m ===
Target: 17-20 minutes
Pace: 2:20-2:40/100m

STRATEGY:
- Start EASY - first 200m sets your race
- Find clear water, don't fight for position
- Sight every 6-8 strokes
- 2-beat kick (save legs!)
- Last 100m: Pick up slightly, prep for T1

=== T1: Swim to Bike ===
Target: Under 2 minutes
- Wetsuit off (if wearing)
- Helmet ON first!
- Shoes, sunglasses, GO
- Run with bike to mount line

=== BIKE: 20km ===
Target: 38-45 minutes
Power: 105-125W (Zone 2-3)

STRATEGY:
- First 5 min: Settle in, find rhythm
- DO NOT go hard on hills early
- Stay in aero when comfortable
- Drink every 10-15 min
- Optional: Gel at 20 min mark
- Last 2 km: Spin higher cadence (100+)

=== T2: Bike to Run ===
Target: Under 90 seconds
- Helmet off, bike racked
- Running shoes, hat/visor
- Quick sip of water, GO

=== RUN: 5km ===
Target: 26-32 minutes
Pace: 8:00-10:00/mile

STRATEGY:
- First 800m WILL feel weird - this is normal!
- Short, quick strides initially
- By 1 mile, legs will feel more normal
- Miles 2-3: Steady, find your groove
- Final 800m: Whatever you've got left!
- SMILE crossing the finish line!

=== NUTRITION ===
Pre-race (2-3 hours before):
- 50-80g carbs (oatmeal, banana, toast)
- 500ml water
- Small coffee if you normally drink it

30 min before:
- Sip sports drink
- Half a gel if desired

During race:
- Swim: Nothing
- Bike: 200-300ml sports drink, optional gel at 20 min
- Run: Water at aid stations, sip Coke if available at end

=== MENTAL CUES ===
- 'Smooth is fast'
- 'Relax your hands and shoulders'
- 'I trained for this'
- 'Smile - you're a triathlete!'

=== REMEMBER ===
Goal #1: HAVE FUN
Goal #2: Don't drown
Goal #3: Finish with a smile

You've done the work. TRUST YOUR TRAINING!

See you at the finish line - YOU'VE GOT THIS!

swim.notes: Start conservative! First 200m sets your race. Don't chase fast swimmers. Sight every 6-8 strokes. Use 2-beat kick to save legs for bike and run.

bike.notes: Do NOT go out too hard. First 5km should feel easy. Stay aero when comfortable. Spin high cadence (100+) in final 2km to prep legs for run.

run.notes: First 800m will feel terrible - that's normal! Use short, quick strides initially. By mile 1, legs will feel more normal. Give everything you have in final 800m!

targetFinish.notes: For first triathlon, aim for the conservative end. Finishing strong and smiling is the goal!

tips: Wetsuit: Practice removing beforehand. Pull from shoulders, step out.
Helmet goes ON first, always.
Keep gear simple: helmet, glasses, shoes.
Run with bike to mount line (usually 50-100m).
Mount at the line, not before!
Dismount at line, run with bike to rack.
Rack bike, helmet off.
Running shoes on (consider elastic laces).
Hat/visor, quick water sip, GO!
Keep it simple and fast.
Arrive 90 min before race start.
Rack bike, note your location (landmark nearby).
Lay towel for visual marker.
Bike gear on left (helmet, glasses, shoes if not clipped in).
Run gear on right (shoes, hat, race belt).
Walk through transitions before race starts.
Know bike out, bike in, run out locations!

preRace.foods: 50-80g carbs: oatmeal, banana, toast with honey, or bagel with peanut butter

thirtyMinBefore.foods: Optional: Half a gel or a few bites of banana
thirtyMinBefore.fluids: Sip sports drink, stay hydrated but don't overdrink

during.bike: 200-300ml sports drink. Optional: 1 gel around 20 min mark
during.run: Water at aid stations. Coke in final mile if available (quick energy boost)

tips: Nothing new on race day - only use nutrition you've practiced
Don't overeat morning of race
Small sips are better than big gulps
Trust your training - you don't need much for a sprint

raceDay.preRaceMeal: Breakfast you've practiced: oatmeal with banana and honey, or toast with peanut butter

warmUp.swim: If possible, 5-10 min easy swim to feel the water and check goggles
warmUp.run: 5 min easy jog + 4x20s strides in the last 30 min before start

whatToExpect.swim: Crowded at start, lots of splashing. Find clear water quickly. Calm down after first 100m.
whatToExpect.t1: You'll feel rushed but take an extra second to do things right. Helmet first!
whatToExpect.bike: Legs will feel great - RESIST going too hard! Save energy for run.
whatToExpect.t2: Legs will feel wobbly getting off bike. Normal! Just move quickly.
whatToExpect.run: First 800m feels TERRIBLE. Stick with it - it gets better after mile 1!
